--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2023/0514 b) Date of Occurrence: 04/11/2024
c) Installation Details: Chimera Multi - AC-8264-248 at
Sector South Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 10/11/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Exhaust System d) Main Assembly: Pylon-D
e) Nomenclature: Exhaust System Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Modified
g) Part No.: PR-9220-H3 h) Sl No.: SN-1619-427
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 17/03/2023 l) Date of Removal: 09/11/2024
Pg No: 131 Ln No: 28 Pg No: 19 Ln No: 27
m) Manufacturing Agency: Pinnacle Aerospace n) Date, Month & Year April 2015
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 4565 Hrs / 438 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Major
b) Defect Observed: Engine vibration level increase. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Corrosion due to moisture accumulation in sealed compartment
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Exhaust System component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Conduct non-destructive testing to verify structural integrity
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Update technical documentation with lessons learned
d) Attributable Code: R - Lapses on the part of Repair Agency/Manufacturer
Remarks: Investigation completed as per established procedures. All findings documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Technical evaluation completed. Proposed preventive measures are appropriate and align with design intent.
Date: 08/12/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Manufacturing quality documentation reviewed. No deviations noted. Concur with investigation findings.
Date: 11/12/2024 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned.
Date: 12/12/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality oversight review completed. Recommend monitoring effectiveness of implemented preventive actions.
Date: 11/12/2024 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Airworthiness implications assessed. Recommend issuance of technical directive for fleet-wide compliance.
Date: 18/12/2024 Signature: Eng. K.N. Iyer
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
